flavor: As you step off the train in Gare d’Orsay, the sun sinks below the Paris skyline. You cannot waste any time. If Nigel Engram is somewhere in Paris, you have to find him and wring the answers from him one way or another.
name: The First Night
text: While you have more Conviction than Doubt, this agenda gains: "When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it."

flavor: The city stirs as cold shadows embrace the streets. There is danger all around you. Danger that you cannot escape. Danger that will follow you to the ends of the earth. When will this waking nightmare end?
name: The Second Night
text: While you have more Conviction than Doubt, this agenda gains: "When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it."

flavor: On the evening of your third night in Paris, a desperate resolve stirs within you. This cat and mouse game cannot go on any longer. One way or another, this night will end it.
name: The Third Night
text: While you have more Conviction than Doubt, this agenda gains: "When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it."

flavor: You pass the Church of St. Barnabé as you exit the train station and cannot help but overhear the organ playing. Is there a sermon this late in the evening? You marvel at the wild and strange chords for a moment before continuing. Paris is a big city, and you have very few leads…
name: The Parisian Conspiracy (v. I)
text: Objective - Spend the requisite number of clues to advance. Objective - At the end of the round, if there are 3 or more doom in play, advance.

flavor: The chords that echo in your mind, the infernal man whose organ-playing intrigues and terrifies you… Perhaps there is a connection between this shadowy presence and The King in Yellow?
name: Pursuing Shadows
text: [reaction] After you successfully attack The Organist: An investigator at your location may place 1 of his or her clues on The Organist. (Group limit 1[per investigator]  times per round.) Objective - If there are 3[per investigator] clues on the Organist, advance.

back_text: Check Campaign Log. - If you intruded on a secret meeting, proceed to (→R2). -Otherwise, proceed to (→R1).
flavor: I knew that every time I met him brought him nearer to the accomplishment of his purpose and my fate. And still I tried to save myself.– Robert W. Chambers, “In the Court of the Dragon,” The King in Yellow
name: Stalked by Shadows
text: [free] Spend 1[per investigator] clues, as a group: Either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or automatically evade The Organist. (Group limit once per round.) Objective - Survive three nights.

flavor: This area is known for its cafés and bars, and is often frequented by starving artists. Perhaps some of these creative types will become famous someday. Most, you assume, will fade into obscurity.
name: Montparnasse
text: [free] Discard a card from your hand: Gain resources equal to the number of [willpower] icons on the discarded card. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: You’ve heard this district to be vibrant and friendly, but the streets feel unusually lonely to you.
name: Montmartre
text: [action]: Reveal the top card of each investigator's deck. You may play an asset revealed by this effect (paying its resource cost), under your control. Shuffle each investigator's deck. (Group limit once per round.)

flavor: You’ve heard this district to be vibrant and friendly, but the streets feel unusually lonely to you.
name: Montmartre
text: [action] Spend 1 resource: Add 1 supply or ammo token to a card you control. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: Le Théâtre du Grand-Guignol specializes in horror shows of a graphic and sometimes amoral nature. It is among the smallest venues in Paris, and one of the most popular.
name: Grand Guignol
text: Forced - After you reveal Grand Guignol: You must either take 2 horror, or shuffle your hand into your deck and draw that many cards from the top of your deck.

flavor: The Palais Garnier is an ornate architectural masterpiece, and one of the most famous opera houses in the world. Strangely, you find the main doors thrown wide open, and a dark mist creeps out from the doorway.
name: Opéra Garnier
text: While you are investigating Opéra Garnier, double the number of skill icons committed to this skill test.

flavor: The Palais Garnier is an ornate architectural masterpiece, and one of the most famous opera houses in the world. Strangely, you find the main doors thrown wide open, and a dark mist creeps out from the doorway.
name: Opéra Garnier
text: While you are investigating Opéra Garnier, double the base value of your skill.

flavor: Built in 1900, this train station was the first urban station in the world to use only electric trains.
name: Gare d'Orsay
text: [action] Spend 1 resource: Move to any Rail location.

flavor: The largest cemetery in Paris, and its first garden cemetery, Père Lachaise is as beautiful as it is haunting.
name: Père Lachaise Cemetery
text: Forced - After you successfully investigate Père Lachaise Cemetery: You cannot leave Père Lachaise Cemetery until the end of the round.

flavor: This underground canal connects the river Seine to the Canal de l’Ourcq. An old, cracked staircase leads down to the canal’s entrance.
name: Canal Saint-Martin
text: [reaction] After you evade an enemy at Canal Saint-Martin: Move that enemy to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: This historic district has recently become less aristocratic, but the old architectural masterwork remains.
name: Le Marais
text: [reaction] When your turn begins, if you are in Le Marais: Draw 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)

flavor: This historic district has recently become less aristocratic, but the old architectural masterwork remains.
name: Le Marais
text: Forced - After you enter Le Marais: For the remainder of the round, you cannot leave Le Marais.

flavor: The most famous cathedral in all of Paris, and one of the finest examples of gothic architecture in the world, Notre-Dame de Paris—“Our Lady of Paris”—is an icon of the city. Light shines out from its stained glass windows, and you can hear a pipe organ inside blaring a bizarre, chaotic melody.
name: Notre-Dame
text:
Each enemy at Notre-Dame gets -1 fight and +1 evade.
[action] Test [willpower] (6). If you succeed, either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or remove 1 doom from the current agenda. (Group limit once per game.)

flavor: The gardens of Luxembourg Palace contain hundreds of scattered statues, monuments, and fountains. It would make for a relaxing walk if you hadn’t come here to escape the winged creatures that screech and soar in the dark sky overhead.
name: Gardens of Luxembourg
text: While a Byakhee enemy is moving, if there is an investigator at Gardens of Luxembourg, that enemy's location is considered to be connected to Gardens of Luxembourg.

back_text: Aloof. Cannot be damaged. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: If The Organist is unengaged, move it 1 location away from the nearest investigator (to a location with no investigators, if possible). If it is engaged, disengage it instead.
flavor: …the point from which it would strike was his infernal eyes. – Robert W. Chambers, “In the Court of the Dragon,” The King in Yellow
name: The Organist
text: Hunter. Cannot be damaged. Forced - After The Organist moves from the hunter keyword, if it is unengaged: Resolve its hunter keyword again. The Organist cannot attack this phase. (Limit once per round).

flavor: If you can hear the beating of its leathery wings, it’s already too late.
name: Stealthy Byakhee
text:
Hunter.
While Stealthy Byakhee is exhausted, it gets -3 fight.

flavor: The implication spoils what would otherwise be a lovely sunset.
name: Twin Suns
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, you must either remove 1 doom from the current agenda, or take 1 horror for each point you failed by.

name: Deadly Fate
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. You must either draw that enemy, or that enemy attacks you . If no enemy is discarded, take 1 horror instead.

name: Torturous Chords
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). If you fail, put Torturous Chords into play in your threat area, with 1 resource on it for each point you failed by. Each time you play a card, increase the cost of that card by 1 and remove 1 resource from Torturous Chords. If Torturous Chords has no resources, discard it.

name: Frozen in Fear
text: Revelation - Put Frozen in Fear into play in your threat area. The first time you perform one of the following actions (move, fight, or evade) each round, it costs 1 additional action. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Frozen in Fear.

name: Lost Soul
